example[0]: The smart kids get good grades and go off to college.
example[1]: I was smart enough to wait for a week.
example[2]: His decision to become a director was a smart move (=sensible thing to do).
definition[1]: trying to seem clever in a disrespectful way
example[3]: Don’t get smart with me, young man.
definition[2]: a smart person is wearing neat attractive clothes and has a generally tidy appearance
definition[3]: smart clothes, buildings etc are clean, tidy, and attractive
definition[4]: fashionable or used by fashionable people
definition[5]: smart machines, weapons, materials etc are controlled by computers and are designed to react in a suitable way depending on the situation
definition[6]: a smart movement is done quickly, especially with force
example[10]: a smart blow on the head
example[11]: She set off at a smart pace (=fairly fast).
definition[7]: to be upset because someone has hurt your feelings or offended you
example[12]: She was still smarting from the insult.
definition[8]: if a part of your body smarts, it hurts with a stinging pain
example[13]: My eyes were smarting with the smoke.
definition[9]: smart design, technology etc is very advanced, in a way that copies human intelligence
example[14]: We specialize in creating smart websites that allow our clients to be in total control.
example[15]: Built-in smart chips constantly monitor ink cartridge levels.
example[16]: This 40-page bonus booklet has smart ideas for increasing your revenue.
